comment.author: 23840779@N06
comment._content: The placement of his hands and feet indicate he is about to spin the propeller. This is how the engine was started.

comment.author: 16096977@N05
comment._content: This is great!!   A piece of history..

comment.author: 10749411@N03
comment._content: First of all agreed, a great piece of history... but can you imagine the craftsmanship to carve that oak propeller, to end up in complete balance?!!

comment.author: 16096977@N05
comment._content:
I also note that this propeller seems to rotate the opposite of most radial engines I have seen.  I just checked on F4U, C-47, and several other types and the direction of rotation, looking from in front of the engine, is counter clockwise.   This prop indicates it turns clockwise.  Interesting.

And you are definitely right.  The "craftsmen" who made propellers like that,  in those days, were the truest of craftsmen.    They "whittled em with love" so to speak..

comment.author: 54498028@N07
comment._content: it is easier for right-handed persons to swing the propeller if it turns clockwise.
